name: Al Rashid Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel! Reasonable price for newly refurbished and very clean rooms with great hot showers available 24hrs. Located at the main roundabout in town, a 10min steep walk from the front gate to Petra (we paid 3 dinar for a one way taxi up the hill) Wifi was slow but reliable and the staff were friendly, happy to have a chat and very helpful. Breakfast was great - it was very large and included pita, eggs, salad, yoghurt etc.
reviews.title: Great spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We originally planned to stay at Saba's next door but after looking at the rooms in each place opted for El Rashid. For price and services Rashid wins but for a more hostel vibe where you can meet others it looked like Saba was better.
reviews.title: Good value.. super friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The wifi seemed to get overtaxed at times, but other than that, this was great value given that Wadi Musa seems a bit high priced. Staff was very friendly. Helped us with doing laundry and with suggestions for things to see. Always handy with a mint tea right when you wanted it. Breakfast was simple but filling. Rooms were large and clean.
reviews.title: Excellent value if not looking for height of luxury

reviews.text: El Rashid is located at the heart of Wadi Musa village. Plenty of mini-markets and eateries around. Rooms are pretty basic (dining room up a few notches, breakfast very decent) but service is impeccable. We arrived in the afternoon and asked reception to book us tickets for Petra by Night (a unique experience but immensely popular!) which they did instantly. We stayed for 3 nights and on the second night we were upgraded to a larger room which was made available in the meantime (they moved all our stuff). They offered us a complimentary dinner (very good) and, when we left, they gave us 2 large bottles of water for the road (a fantastic gesture in this hot country - we were setting off on the long journey to Wadi Rum). They let us call our Petra guide on his mobile for free from the reception phone. Receptionists and waiters very friendly and polite, made us feel at home. Only drawbacks: a. It's a 30' walk up and downhill (or a 5' taxi ride) to the entrance of the Petra site (taxis are plentiful and cheap); b. They don't take Visa (only Mastercard): they hadn't told us from the beginning so at checkout we had to rush to the bank (right opposite) to change euros (banks were closing earlier that day, a close call but we finally made it!). Still, we left with the best impressions.
reviews.title: Good value for Petra - but only limited times for hot water

reviews.text: I arrived at El Rashid without reservations at 3pm and as it was the end of the winter and during the low-season, I was quoted 20 Jordanian dinar per night bed and breakfast and ended up staying for two nights. There’s free wi-fi in the lobby and in the corridors and sometimes in the rooms but the latter’s more intermittent. Crucially, there’s heating during the night (use the air-con) and hot-water is available till 10pm and again in the morning. Very helpful English-speaking staff and they can help organise night tours of Petra and Little Petra (10-15 JD) including taxi hire.
reviews.title: Excellent Value indeed

reviews.text: We arrived late, and the management greeted us with mint tea (nice touch), although the lobby did seem to smell a little funny. There is no elevator in this hotel, and since we were on the second floor up from the lobby, dealing with luggage was a handful. On arrival, someone carried the luggage upstairs, but we were left to fend for ourselves on the way down. Rooms TINY!! as was the bathroom, but I will say they seemed clean. The phone did not work ?? in the room. Light bulbs were burnt out, and required us to walk downstairs to request replacements. Wi fi in the rooms a definate positive thing. Breakfast: Hummus, boiled eggs, pita jams..and INSTANT COFFEE ??? really?? The hotel offered a box lunch for 5 JOD...If you are heading to Petra, I highly recommend this. It is GREAT! The box lunch included, pita bread, apple, cucumber, tomatoe, 2 sweets, flafel, juice box...well worth the money. All in all an Ok hotel in the center of town, with supermarket for water and basics, fast food and bakery ATM all within one block. Front desk staff were helpful and even suggested where to park the car at Petra. All in all a good place,but would suggest they make real coffee in the morning.
reviews.title: convenient hotel near Petra

reviews.text: Stayed for 3 nights and it was an excellent stay. Staff organised taxis to various places and the drivers were very good.
reviews.title: Excellent value for money
Enjoyable stay
reviews.text: Good food, without any issues, especially as it is newly refurbed. Would recommend to anyone.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked our 3 night stay at this comfortable hotel directly via email and was very happy with the helpful replies I received to my enquiries. The half board rate was excellent value and it was wonderful after two long days walking around Petra not to have to think about where we were going to eat. (We also took advantage of the packed lunches the hotel is happy to provide.) The chef prepared good, substantial, evening meals (soup, salad platter, main course and dessert) and we were only sorry that there were not many more guests sharing the dining room with us. The bedroom was comfortable and the ensuite modern and clean. There is a large, relaxing area downstairs where guest can meet one another.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel in the heart of the city !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a friendly, family run hotel and we can thoroughly recommend it to anyone who wants to visit Petra without spending a fortune. We enjoyed our stay very much.
reviews.title: Good location, basic and clean accommodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fabulous hotel for the price, with a decent breakfast thrown in. For once the rooms was actual better than the hotel photos! 2 minute walk to the bus station and Petra entrance about 15 min away. To fellow reviewer complaining about rooms being cold, tha A/C works as a heater.
reviews.title: Nice refurbished rooms

reviews.text: We got a nice big room, but teethclattering cold (in January). Great breakfast but yet again no warmth in the restaurant. We wondered if we were the only guests since there neither were heat nor light on at the hotel (economy mode?). The entrance to the site were 10 minutes walk from the hotel. Helpful staff. We asked for taxi two times, and they arranged free transportation both times :)
reviews.title: Large rooms in the centre of Petra (city)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Recommendable! (Bring pyjamas in winter ;) )
reviews.title: Excellent and helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is very clean and completely renovated, with wifi also in the bedrooms. At the beginning, we booked for two nights, but we stayed for four nights: we had a very pleasant experience, thanks to the staff, and in particular to Leith. He organized our trip to Wadi Rum (a good trip for which we spent less than the other people we met there); and he helped us solve the accident we had with a tyre of our rented car. Coming back to Petra from the desert, a tyre basically exploded. Leith called the car rental manager, negotiated with him, and called his brother, who brought my boyfriend to a mechanic.We spent a couple of hours chatting and drinking a tea with him. The whole staff was friendly and nice with us. A great experience!
reviews.title: Great Value for Money!

reviews.text: My husband and I enjoyed a very comfortable 3-night stay at this hotel in December 2012. We arrived in Wadi Musa very late at night not having a hotel already booked. Thankfully, Al-Rashid hotel had a room available for us! The hotel manager, Laith, was really friendly and helpful and helped us settle into the room. The room was great- a big bedroom and a well-sized, clean and modern bathroom. In the morning, we were up before dawn to be at Petra as soon as the gates opened. We weren't expecting to have breakfast ready for us as we were leaving so early, but Laith was down in the lobby and prepared (himself) a wonderful and very generous breakfast pack for each of us to take with us to Petra. Again, this was very unexpected and very kind. These kinds of good deeds are very hard to come by these days.
reviews.title: excellent choice in Petra/Wadi Musa

reviews.text: Hi everyone,
reviews.title: petra ..... hotels

reviews.text: We had a great stay in AL-Rashid.... reached unannounced with family and got a great room with breakfast at just 30 JD.... Not only the price and location but the overall ambiance and staff were great. Wi fi in rooms with good speed.ATM next door so easy to get money
reviews.title: Great hotel for the money

reviews.text: Just a km short of Petra but u need a taxi on your way up for sure....
reviews.title: good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Try food at a number of fast food joints strewn all across near the hotelood.
reviews.title: Friendly staff and great experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank u for a good stay.
reviews.title: Clean and comfortable Hotel with extraordinary friendly and helpful staff

aka: Al Rashid Hotel Jordan/Petra - Wadi Musa
description: • Located in the heart of the city our guests can enjoy local Bedouine life and take a stroll through shopping venues, restaurants or cafés. Turkish bath it is only a 1 minute away and different banks, doctors and pharmacies are also just around the corner. • Al Rashid Hotel offers modern rooms with air-condition, heating and Satellite flat-screen TV. All rooms are fitted with comfortable nice furniture and functional private bathrooms with hot water for 24-hours, excellent water pressure, private towels and hairdryer. The rooms have recently been refurbished. • Free Internet Wi-Fi is available in the whole building and in all rooms. • Breakfast, Lunch or Dinner are served daily in our spacious restaurant. Enjoy our local and international meals. • The gate of Petra ruins is just a 10-15 minutes’ walk from the hotel. • Al Rashid offers transportation on low costs over whole Jordan
